name: websearchengine
description: Search the web directly from inside VSCode on your favorite search engines / websites (add as many as you like, customizable in settings like Google Chrome / Edge)

walkthroughs.title: Web Search Walkthrough
walkthroughs.description:
Thanks for installing Web Search
To get started, here are some quick tips for using the extension, so you can boost your productivity.

steps.title: Perform a Demo Search using Selected Text ü§è
steps.description:
The extension will always prefer to search using the selected text.
This step will simulate selecting some example text, ``eslint``, and then run the Web Search extension.
[Try Searching Using Selected Text, 'eslint'](command:WebSearch.selectedTextDemo)

media.altText: Screenshot displaying the Web Search extension with selected text of 'eslint'

steps.title: Search using the Search Bar üîé
steps.description:
This step will run a Web Search with **demo mode** on to show you how it looks with multiple sites
Simply run the command, type a search query in the search bar above, and see the site list options.
[Try Out the Search Bar](command:WebSearch.firstRun)

media.altText: Screenshot of the Web Search submenu with multiple sites

steps.title: Add Your Own Search Engines ‚ûï
steps.description:
This step will open the extension settings.
Add search engines using Item/Value pairs like the GIF to the right.
Search engines are added in the same way you would add one in your web browser, using ``%s`` in the URL to replace the search query.
[Start Adding Custom Search Engines](command:WebSearch.openSettings)

media.altText: GIF of adding a new search engine to the Web Search extension

steps.title: Try Your Own Search Engines üîé
steps.description:
Now that you have added your own search engines, this step will show you how it looks with your custom-added search engines
Simply run the command, type a search query, and see the site list options.
[Try WebSearch With Your Custom Search Engines](command:WebSearch.setContext)

media.altText: Screenshot of the Web Search submenu with multiple sites

steps.title: Turn Off Demo Mode ‚öôÔ∏è
steps.description:
This step will turn off demo mode so the extension will only display the search engines you recently added.
You can always turn demo mode back on in the extension settings (set ``webSearch.useDefaultSearchEnginesList`` to ``True``).
[Turn off Demo Mode](command:WebSearch.changeSetting)

media.altText: GIF of adding a new search engine to the Web Search extension

steps.title: FYI - Only One Search Engine 1Ô∏è‚É£
steps.description:
If you only have one search engine in your custom settings (and **Demo Mode** is off), then the extension will automatically search from that site.
It will not pop up with the submenu of sites to select from (**Defaults to Google**).
Remember to add more search engines if you want to search from multiple sites.
[Add Additional Custom Search Engines](command:WebSearch.openSettings)

media.altText: GIF of adding a new search engine to the Web Search extension

steps.title: Search Using Keyboard Shortcut ‚å®Ô∏è
steps.description:
You can use the Web Search extension in multiple ways.
This step will show you that you can run the extension using the keyboard shortcut of:
``Alt + `s`.

media.altText: Keyboard shortcut for the Web Search extension

steps.title: Search Using Keyboard Shortcut ‚å®Ô∏è
steps.description:
You can use the Web Search extension in multiple ways.
This step will show you that you can run the extension using the keyboard shortcut of:
``Alt + ``` (backtick).

media.altText: Keyboard shortcut for the Web Search extension

steps.title: Search From the Context Menu üñ±Ô∏è
steps.description: You can right click on any selected text in your code and search from the context menu.

media.altText: Running the Web Search extension from the context menu

steps.title: Search From the Command Palette ‚ò∞
steps.description: You can also use the extension at any time via the Command Palette. Simply select ``Web Search`` from the Command Palette and type a search query.

media.altText: Running the Web Search extension from the Command Palette

webSearch.searchEngine.markdownDescription:
***Depreciated - use `searchEngines` instead***

Search engine to use for the Web Search extension. Replace the query with ```%s```, e.g. ```https://www.google.com/search?q=%s```, the same way as you would when adding additional search engines to the Chrome browser settings.
webSearch.searchEngine.patternErrorMessage: Value must be valid URL, starting with http/https and containing '%s' query wildcard

webSearch.enableContextMenu.markdownDescription: Enable the Web Search context menu item (right click menu) in the editor

webSearch.useDefaultSearchEnginesList.markdownDescription: Enable the Web Search extension to use default values. Essentially, this is the extension's ***Demo Mode***. Disabling this will favor your own custom search engines list entered in `#webSearch.searchEngines#`.

webSearch.allowManualSearch.markdownDescription:
Enable the extension to run when no text is selected.

If this setting is enabled, a __search bar__ will prompt for a search query when the extension's search command is run by using the extension's keyboard shortcut.

webSearch.searchEngines.markdownDescription:
Search engines to use for the Web Search extension. 
***Item*** is the search engine name
***Value*** is the full url with the search query. Replace the query with ```%s```, e.g. ```https://www.google.com/search?q=%s```, the same way as you would when adding additional search engines to Chrome or Edge in the browser settings.
Add search engines using the **Add Item** button below.

additionalProperties.description: Item is the name of the search engine. Value is the search engine URL. The URL must start with http:// or https:// and contain the query parameter '%s' which will be replaced with the selected text.

webSearch.defaultSearchEngines.markdownDescription: Default search engines to use for the Web Search extension. If you want to use your own, disable the new checkbox `#webSearch.useDefaultSearchEnginesList#`
